project.name: pattern_empty_index
project.description:
This model identifies increases in a stock's price within a specific time interval. The model contains a Source window and a Pattern window. The Source window receives an event stream of stock trades from an input file that is included with this example. The Pattern window defines the events of interest to be matched. The model is stateless, that is, the index on the Source window has the type pi_EMPTY. Events are not retained in any window, and are transformed and passed through. This prevents the Pattern window from growing infinitely. The pattern defined in the Pattern window consists of the following events of interest:
Event 1: Occurrences of the stock symbol GMTC Event 2: Re-occurrences of the stock symbol GMTC where the price and quantity of the stock has gone up 50% compared to event 1 Event 3: Re-occurrences of the stock symbol GMTC where the price and quantity of the stock has gone up 50% compared to event 2 Note: In order for the pattern to be matched, all events of interest must occur within 200 milliseconds of each other. The time at which each event occurred is specified in the trade_time field in the Source windowâ€™s output schema. This example uses three files listed below:
The XML file (model.xml) associated with this example. stocktrades.csv is an input file. This file contains a list of stock trades. output.csv is an output file. When you run the model, the matched patterns are written to the output.csv file.

window-source.name: sourceWindow_01
window-source.description: The sourceWindow_01 window is a Source window. This is where a list of stock trades from the stocktrades.csv file enter the model. When you pass data into this window, specify the following date format: %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S

window-pattern.name: patternWindow_01
window-pattern.description: The patternWindow_01 window is a Pattern window. This is where the stock trade patterns are matched and written to an output.csv file.

events.event: symbol=="GMTC" and s==symbol and p0==price and q0==quant
s==symbol and p0<price*1.5 and q0<quant*1.5 and p1==price and q1==quant
